form.rules.email.valid: The input is not valid E-mail!
calc.iol.name: ZZ IOL
calc.iol.instructions: Selection of IOL (Intra-ocula Lens) for normal cornea to calculate the IOL refraction
calc.iol.notes: SE=Spherical Equivalent; CT=Corneal Thickness; AC=Anterior Chambler Depth (Internal); AL=Axial Length; LT=Lens Thickness; PP=Puple Power (4mm) (Available from CSO Sirius or Zeus)
calc.tiol.name: ZZ TIOL
calc.tiol.instructions: Selection of Toric IOL (Intra-ocula Lens) for normal cornea to calculate the Toric IOL refraction and axis
calc.tiol.notes: SE=Spherical Equivalent; CT=Corneal Thickness; AC=Anterior Chambler Depth (Internal); AL=Axial Length; LT=Lens Thickness; PP=Puple Power (4mm) (Available from CSO Sirius or Zeus); Corn Asti=Corneal Astigmatism (4mm); SIA=Surgically Induced Astigmatism
calc.iolpro.name: ZZ IOL Pro
calc.iolpro.rawdata:
Currently only CSO Sirius or Zeus .zcs documents are supported (include more than 3 repeatable results)
After the payment is successful
calc.iolpro.pay: RMB 200 Each (After the payment is successful, the result will be given within 48 hours)
calc.iolplus.name: ZZ IOL Plus
calc.iolplus.rawdata:
Currently only CSO Sirius or Zeus .zcs documents are supported (include more than 3 repeatable results)

calc.iolplus.pay: RMB 200 Each (After the payment is successful, the result will be given within 48 hours)
calc.iolold.name: ZZ IOL
calc.iolold.rawdata:
Currently only CSO Sirius or Zeus .zcs documents are supported (include more than 3 repeatable results)
After the payment is successful
calc.iolold.pay: RMB 200 Each (After the payment is successful, the result will be given within 48 hours)
calc.ar.name: ZZ AR (Auto-compensation Refraction) Calculator
calc.ar.instructions: Used to assist surgical strategy planning for Topo-Guide refractive surgery, By calculating the compensation diopter while correcting HOAs for virgin cornea
calc.ar.notes: Mani=Manifested; TMR=Topogray Modified Refraction; AR=After Auto-compensation (No Nomogramm)
calc.vr.name: ZZ VR (Vector-compensation Refraction) Calculator
calc.vr.instructions: Used to assist surgical strategy planning for Topo-Guide / Wavefront-Guide refractive surgery, By calculating the compensation diopter while correcting HOAs for virgin cornea
calc.vr.notes: C7~C13=Corresponded HOAs under selected Opic Zone in the excimer device, Optical Society of America(OSA) Standard (μm); Mani=Manifest refraction; VR=After vector-compensation (No Nomogramm)
calc.vr.changeLog.1_1.title: ZZ VR公式更新 V1.1版
calc.vr.changeLog.1_1:
• 修改了已知特殊情况下引起计算结果偏差较大的BUG
  • 优化了球镜计算结果
  • 目标散光结果，从0.00DC更改到-0.25DC Ax180，降低术后逆规散光的比例
calc.vrpro.name: ZZ VR (Vector-compensation Refraction) Pro Calculator
calc.vrpro.instructions: Used to assist surgical strategy planning for Topo-Guide / Wavefront-Guide refractive surgery, By calculating the compensation diopter while correcting HOAs for special treatment
calc.vrpro.notes: C7~C13=Corresponded HOAs under selected Opic Zone in the excimer device, Optical Society of America(OSA) Standard (μm); Mani=Manifest refraction; VR=After vector-compensation (No Nomogramm)
calc.lsa.name: ZZ LSA
calc.lsa.instructions: Design of surgical strategy for Q-value guide refractive surgery To calculate the ΔQ, for obtaining the expected ΔLSA (Longitudinal Spherical Aberration, Diopter)
calc.lsa.notes: Vertex K=Tangential Curvature; SE=Spherical Equivalent; e=ecc of cornea;
calc.icl.name: ZZ ICL
calc.icl.instructions:
Selection of ICL(Implantable Collamer Lens)
To calculate the ICL refraction and estimated vaulting hight
calc.icl.notes: Mani=Manifest refraction; SIA=Surgically Induced Astigmatism; CT=Corneal Thickness; AC=Anterior Chambler Depth (Internal); LT=Lens Thickness (Optional); H(0) to V(90)=Direction of ICL major axis; STS=Sulcus to Sulcus; H/V=Horizontal / Vertical
calc.iclv.name: ZZ ICLV
calc.iclv.instructions:
Selection of ICL (Implantable Collamer Lens) Diameter
To estimated vaulting hight after ICL implantation
calc.iclv.notes: LT=Lens Thickness; H(0) to V(90)=Direction of ICL major axis; STS=Sulcus to Sulcus; H/V=Horizontal / Vertical
calc.ticl.name: ZZ TICL
calc.ticl.instructions: Design of surgical strategy for adjustment of TICL(Toric Implantable Collamer Lens) axis error. To calculate the adjustment direction and angle of TICL in the current state, in order to reduce the residual astigmatism
calc.ticl.notes: No new main incision; no replacement of TICL; Mani=Manifest refraction before TICL implantation; Resi=Residual manifest refraction after TICL implantation; SIA=Surgically Induced Astigmatism; Esti=Estimated diopter
calc.sia.name: ZZ SIA (Surgically Induced Astigmatism) Calculator
calc.sia.instructions: Used to calculate the diopter after introducing SIA
calc.vsas.name: ZZ Vector-Refraction Calculator
calc.vsas.instructions: Used to calculate the vector-sum or vector-substraction of two diopters
calc.mean.name: ZZ Mean ± SD (Standard Deviation) of Vector-refraction Calculator
calc.mean.instructions: Used to calculate the Mean ± SD of multiple diopters
calc.exop.name: ZZ EX500 Visual Axis Tracking Calculator
calc.exop.instructions: Adjust aiming beam according to ZZ EX500 method, to make ablation centered on the optic axis
calc.exop.notes: K=Tangential curvature of corneal vertical axis; G-R=Distance between Green dot and Red dot
calc.ok.name: ZZ OK (Orthokeratoloy) Lens Fitting Calculator for Central Area Abnormal Cornea (e.g. post refractive surgery, etc.)
calc.ok.notes: K (9mm)=Mean tangential curvature of 9mm of corneal flat axis; AC=Simulated Sim-K of normal cornea
calc.pcprl.name: PC-PRL Refraction Calculator
calc.pcprl.notes: Mani=Manifest refraction;  AC=Anterior Chambler Depth (Internal); CT=Corneal Thickness(Optional)
